publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-32 Malcolm Chisholm: Seafield Waste Water Treatment Works—That the Parliament welcomes the commitment of the previous Deputy Minister for Environment and Rural Development to provide resources to rectify the serious odour problems at the Seafield Waste Water Treatment Works; considers that the new Scottish Executive should reaffirm that commitment; notes the new powers given to local authorities from 1 April 2007 to require high odour standards of Scottish Water, and calls on Scottish Water and the City of Edinburgh Council to make immediate use of the resources announced by the previous deputy minister in order to deal urgently with this totally unacceptable smell.
